description: Two oversized, anthropomorphic daisies with angry expressions loom over a small human man. The man hangs precariously from a petal of the larger daisy, looking up fearfully at the flowers. The scene subverts the traditional image of delicate flowers, presenting them instead as menacing figures engaged in a sinister game. The situation is surreal, depicting nature as a threatening force capable of inflicting harm upon a helpless individual through a twisted version of a playful activity.
caption: "And now we're going to play she-loves-me, she-loves-me-not!"
